reviews.text: La verdad el local est√° m√°s o menos pero el servicio y la comida dir√≠a que les falta por aprender entiendo que el platillo tiene que tener un precio m√°s o menos pero yo ped√≠ uno de barbacoa y hubo m√°s hueso que otra cosa para acabar tambi√©n ped√≠ una sopa de marisco que me trajeron con el cilantro podrido y los limones cortados hacia d√≠as atr√°s . The food was good, the establishment clean, staff friendly, prices reasonable... The loud music at a restaurant that forces its customers to yell at each other is always a bit annoying.

* not pictured but the best dish was chicken, shrimp and mushrooms in a Chipotle sauce and I would return to order that.

After spending the afternoon at the Botanical Garden, my wife and I decided to take a walk into Norwood to try the closest restaurant we could find that had a decent Yelp rating. We were not disappointed. Estrellita Poblana was cheery, delightful, and authentic, and has an impressive menu for a cozy neighborhood spot. The guacamole was delicious, as were the selection of tacos we tried, and the cocktails absolutely hit the spot, and everything was priced far more reasonably than what you'd expect to pay in other parts of the city. We'll definitely be back, and I'd recommend this place to anyone willing to venture 10 minutes up the road from the Metro North station.

i always come here and i order alot. Today i came in and i ordered food, i bought my own pepsi zero because they didn't have and i cant have sugar and they told me i cant have my own drink even if I'm ordering a-lot of food. I found it so strange, I always order here and it‚Äôs not like im bringing outside food.

Im big on customer service and they lost me with this. They didn't consider if I cant have sugar or have health issues, they didn't even care. Then before I left my daughter noticed another table in which a man had a sprite from outside right on the table and they said nothing to him at all. Anyway, I ate quickly and left, It was really akward.

We had a wonderful experience here!!! The guacamole was so fresh and perfectly flavorful. Our dishes were also amazing: huarache, tacos and plantains. The space was so clean and service was amazing. Will definitely be back!!!

Mexican restaurant is a great place to try some authentic Mexican cuisine. The food is always fresh and flavorful, and the atmosphere is lively and fun. Service is usually very good, and prices are reasonable. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a tasty meal.
I am a huge fan of this local chain, but this one is not my favorite. No chips and salsa, waitresses were not as friendly as other location and sparcely decorated. I likely won't be back.

The sad part is that the food is actually really freaking good here. I suggest maybe ordering take out instead. Never again for me.

Ordered on grub hub. Paid $4 for 4oz of Guacamole and received a small portion. I put it on my kitchen scale and it was not even 3oz. I figured it must be a mistake so I called the restaurant. They said it‚Äôs 4oz and that the kitchen fills the containers to the top. The container doesn‚Äôt even hold 4oz. There‚Äôs 4tbsp at most. Picture is terrible but you can see the scale says 2.952 oz‚Ä¶ even with the container adding weight. A scam.

Started coming to this place when it first opened.  The quality of the food  I ordered (Tacos with Beef or Shrimp) was and remains superb.  They also offer good drinks like an Ochata.

However, in recent days, prices have substantially increased.  A taco combo (three tacos) once $9.75 with fillings has now increased to almost $12.  The raising of less than fair prices makes it harder to recommend.

For transparency,  I've gone to another location on Westchester Avenue, prior to this. I had such a great food experience there, I was ECSTATIC when I realized there was a location so close to me. Needless to say, I've eaten at THIS‚Ä¶
